intro: Vittadinia triloba var. dissecta, commonly known as the dissected vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely dissected, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster, typically blooming in spring. This variety is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
